message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a new sparse subspace clustering method that uses an $\ell^{0}$-norm induced sparse similarity graph. This method is compared to existing methods on various data sets, indicating that it is likely to be relevant to the machine learning (cs.LG) and computer vision (cs.CV) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the convergence of the proposed method, suggesting that it may be relevant to the information theory (cs.IT) and numerical analysis (cs.NA) sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes a regularized version of the $\ell^{0}$-graph that encourages nearby data to have similar neighbors, which may be relevant to the social and information networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
